title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
description: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy is a comedy science fiction series created by Douglas Adams. The series follows the adventures of Arthur Dent, following the destruction of the Earth by the Vogons, a race of unpleasant and bureaucratic aliens, and his journey with his friend Ford Prefect, who turns out to be an alien researcher who was stranded on Earth for fifteen years while gathering information for the titular Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy, a pan-galactic encyclopaedia and travel guide for hitchhikers.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: To Kill a Mockingbird is a novel by Harper Lee published in 1960. It was instantly successful, winning the Pulitzer Prize and quickly becoming a classic of modern American literature. The story is set in the fictional town of Maycomb, Alabama during the Great Depression. It follows the experiences of Jean Louise ('Scout') Finch, as she witnesses the racial injustice and the courage and compassion of her father, Atticus Finch, who defends a black man against false charges of rape.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
description: The Hunger Games is a dystopian novel by American author Suzanne Collins. The first book in The Hunger Games trilogy, it was published on September 14, 2008 by Scholastic Press. The story is set in Panem, a dystopian future society in which children are forced to fight to the death in an annual televised event.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
description: The Book Thief is a historical novel by Markus Zusak set in Nazi Germany during World War II. The story is narrated by Death and follows Liesel Meminger, a young girl who is sent to live with foster parents in Molching. Liesel learns to read and steals books, which she shares with her foster father.

title: The Martian
author: Andy Weir
description: The Martian is a science fiction novel by Andy Weir. The story follows an American astronaut who is stranded on Mars after his team is forced to evacuate the planet due to a severe dust storm. The astronaut must use his ingenuity and engineering skills to survive on Mars until a rescue mission can be launched.

title: Gone Girl
author: Gillian Flynn
description: Gone Girl is a psychological thriller novel by Gillian Flynn. The story follows Nick Dunne, a man whose wife Amy disappears on their fifth wedding anniversary. Nick is the prime suspect in her disappearance, but he insists that he is innocent. As the story unfolds, it becomes clear that there is more to Amy than meets the eye.

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
description: The Kite Runner is a novel by Khaled Hosseini. The story is set in Afghanistan and follows Amir, a young boy who befriends Hassan, a Hazara boy. Amir's father is a wealthy businessman who favors Hassan over Amir. As they grow up, Amir betrays Hassan and they drift apart. Years later, Amir returns to Afghanistan to redeem himself.

title: The Help
author: Kathryn Stockett
description: The Help is a historical novel by Kathryn Stockett. The story is set in Jackson, Mississippi during the Civil Rights Movement. The story is told from the perspectives of three women: Aibileen Clark, a black maid who has raised 17 white children; Minny Jackson, a black maid who is outspoken and refuses to be treated as less than; and Skeeter Phelan, a white woman who decides to write a book about the experiences of black maids in Jackson.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: The Alchemist is a novel by Paulo Coelho. The story is about a young shepherd named Santiago who travels from his homeland in Spain to the Egyptian desert in search of treasure buried near the Pyramids. Along the way, Santiago meets a variety of people who teach him about life and the importance of following one's dreams.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
description: The Book Thief is a historical novel by Markus Zusak set in Nazi Germany during World War II. The story is narrated by Death and follows Liesel Meminger, a young girl who is sent to live with foster parents in Molching. Liesel learns to read and steals books, which she shares with her foster father.
relatedBooks: All the Light We Cannot See

title: Little Women
author: Louisa May Alcott
description: Little Women is a novel by Louisa May Alcott. The story follows the March sisters: Meg, Jo, Beth, and Amy, as they grow up during the American Civil War. The novel is known for its strong female characters and its message of hope and resilience.
